Y = 2,8,8,2 and Z = 2,6.
Y will readily give off its 2 valence electrons and Z will accept the 2 electrons in order to achieve octet configuration. Hence, the compound YZ is formed by ionic bonding.

text: Chemicals that are produced in small quantities and with very degree of purity are
subject: CHEMISTRY

explanation.text:
Explanation
300cm3 of 0.4moldm3

1000cm3 contains 0.4mole

300cm3 will contain \(\frac{300 \times 0.4}{1000}\)

= 0.12mole

Number of moles = \(\frac{Mass}{\text {Molecular mass}}\)

Mass = number of moles x m.mass

= 0.12 x 56 = 6.72g

explanation.text:
Explanation
6.02 x 1023 molecules is 1mole
1.204 x 1024 molecules will be......

\(\frac{1.204 \times 10^24 \times 1}{6.02 \times 10^23}\)

\(\frac{1.204 \times 10}{6.02}\) = \(\frac{12.04}{6.02}\) = 2moles

text:
Consider the following ionic equation:
Cr2O72- + 14H+ + ne- \(\to\) 2Cr3+ + 7H2O.
The value of n in the equation is_______?
subject: CHEMISTRY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Al(s) \(\to\) Al3+(aq) + 3e- ______(i)
Cu2+(aq) + 2e- \(\to\) Cu(s) ________(ii)

To balance the electrons, multiply equation (i) by 2 and equation (ii) by 3 and then add the resulting equations

2Al(s) \(\to\)2Al3+(aq) + 3e-
3cu2+(aq) + 6e- \(\to\)3Cu(s)
2Al(s) + 3Cu2+(aq) \(\to\) 3Cu(s) + 2Al3+(aq)

subject: CHEMISTRY

explanation.text:
Explanation
C2H4(g) + 3O2(g) \(\to\) 2CO2(g) + 2H2O(l)

1 mole of ethene required 3 moles of O2
28g of ethene required 3 x 22.4dm3 of O2

14g will require \(\frac{14 \times 3 \times 22.4dm^3}{28}\)

= 33.6dm3
